Key Match Events: India 156 for 0 (Jaiswal 93*, Gill 58*) beat Zimbabwe 152 for 7 (Raza 46, Marumani 32, Khaleel 2-32, Dube 1-11) by ten wickets
Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill made light work of a 153-run target, sauntering home in just 15.2 overs
Wessly Madhevere and Tadiwanashe Marumani added 63 in 8.4 overs to give Zimbabwe a platform
Raza flicked the switch with five overs remaining, hitting a 90-metre six and a four and a six
Jaiswal hit three fours off left-arm seamer Richard Ngavara in the first over
Gill took over, helping himself against Faraz Akram's gentle seam-ups in a exquisite display of hitting-on-the-up
Post-Match Reflections: Yashasvi Jaiswal ended up 93 not out, having displayed his full range in an exhilarating display reflecting the type of intent that won India the T20 World Cup last month after 17 years
Miscellaneous Highlights: India had plenty to cheer about in Harare
Zimbabwe's most-assured batting effort wasn't enough to mount a challenge against India's young IPL stars
India's fifth-bowlers shine after Zimbabwe's solid foundation
India raised their fifty in just 3.5 overs with Jaiswal contributing 39
Jaiswal got to his half-century off 29 balls
Gill then took over, helping himself against Faraz Akram's gentle seam-ups in a exquisite display of hitting-on-the-up
The only point of interest was if Jaiswal could get the 17 of the 18 remaining runs needed to get to a hundred
